== Main Inclusion Report for rampart ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/r/rampart]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures.
# ''Rationale:''.
** Build dependency of Eucalyptus.
** Apart of the EucalyptusInMainSpec spec.
0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=rampart|CVE]]</nowiki> entries.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=rampart|Secunia]]</nowiki> history.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** No daemons.
** No network activity.
** it does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data.
** No source code review.
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** This package should always work out of the box.
** No debconf questions are asked.
** Not apart of debian.
** <nowiki>[[http://ws.apache.org/rampart/c/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous.
** <nowiki>[[http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS2|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>.
** No special hardware is needed.
** Is there a test suite in the upstream source or packaging ?  Is it enabled to run in the build ?
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant.
** Uses cdbs with simple-patchsystem.
0. ''Dependencies:''
** cdbs - in main
** debhelper - in main 
** autotools-dev - in main
** libxml2-dev - in main
** libapr1-dev - in main
** apache2-threaded-dev - in main
** libaxis2c-dev - in universe
0. ''Maintenance:''
* The package is maintained by Michael Vogt in Ubuntu, it is not in Debian. It looks like a trivial package to maintain since there are no bug reports so far. 
* The Ubuntu Server Team will be responsible for the maintainenace of this package.
